title: Oklahoma falls to No. 9 and the American Athletic shows strength in NCAA Re-Rank 1-130
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg breaks down the latest Amway Coaches Poll. USA TODAY

Oklahoma is down four spots to No. 9 while the top four teams held serve in the latest USA TODAY Sports Re-Rank 1-130.

Replacing the Sooners at No. 5 is Penn State, which moved to 8-0 with a 28-7 win in the rain against Michigan State. While No. 4 LSU put together another impressive win, this time against No. 13 Auburn, Clemson remained at No. 3 after trouncing Boston College.

The Sooners were leapfrogged by No. 6 Oregon, No. 7 Florida and No. 8 Baylor.

While the Re-Rank is not necessarily a primer for how the College Football Playoff selection committee will approach seeding the top teams in the country come November and December, that Oklahoma is only down to No. 9 speaks to the lack of diversity in the championship race.

Oklahoma receiver CeeDee Lamb is pushed out of bounds by Kansas State defenders Wesley Burris (49) and linebacker Nick Allen during the first quarter at Bill Snyder Family Stadium. (Photo: Scott Sewell, Scott Sewell-USA TODAY Sports)

Given that Oklahoma has just one win against an opponent currently holding a winning record — that would be Texas, which is now 5-3 and ranked No. 31 this week — there's an argument for docking the Sooners even lower in the Re-Rank. But the teams just behind Oklahoma aren't worthy of the bump: No. 10 Georgia has scuffled, No. 11 Utah similarly has just one win against a team with a winning record and No. 12 SMU doesn't have the strength of schedule to move ahead of the Sooners even as one of the Bowl Subdivision's few undefeated teams.

TIGERS MOVE UP: LSU now No. 2 behind Alabama in Amway Coaches poll

FOOTBALL FOUR: Alabama, LSU ready for showdown as Oklahoma falls

WINNERS AND LOSERS: Highs and lows from Week 9 in college football

This week's Re-Rank is noteworthy for the heavy presence of teams from the American in the Top 25. In addition to SMU, the league has No. 20 Cincinnati, No. 23 Memphis, No. 24 Central Florida and No. 25 Navy. The conference is better than the ACC and in terms of its top third can easily rival the Pac-12.

New to the Top 25: No. 24 UCF, No. 25 Navy.

Out of the Top 25: No. 30 Iowa State, No. 31 Texas.
description: There's another change at the top of  NCAA Re-Rank with Oklahoma falling to No. 9 after a loss. The American Athletic has five teams in Top 25.
